intro: Taraktogenos kunstleri var. tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly taraktogenos, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage that gives it a distinctive, woolly appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, adding a subtle ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a decorative plant in arid landscapes.
